subheading: date: mon, 11 oct 1999 09:23:12 -0400 from: “rebecca brewer” (rbrewer@rvda.org) to: newsfeedback@wired.com subject: microsoft’s linux myths posting as a resident of the politically charged washington dc area, microsoft’s linux myths posting (“microsoft lambastes linux,” 8.oct.99) reads completely like a badly warped piece of campaign material from a not-so-popular incumbant. i can’t believe how defensive […]
author: wired blogs
text: date: mon, 11 oct 1999 09:23:12 -0400 from: "rebecca brewer" (rbrewer@rvda.org)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: microsoft's linux myths postingas a resident of the politically charged washington dc area, microsoft's linux myths posting ("microsoft lambastes linux," 8.oct.99) reads completely like a badly warped piece of campaign material from a not-so-popular incumbant. i can't believe how defensive this spinster article comes across, with its half-truths about the linux operating system! the fact that microsoft feels compelled to attack and defend linux is a credit to linux and its supporters.
